newsitem.title: ITALY: San Paolo to offer total 220 mln shares.
newsitem.headline: San Paolo to offer total 220 mln shares.

text.p: Italian bank San Paolo di Torino will put 220 million ordinary shares up for sale when it makes a global share offer on May 19-23, the bank said in a newspaper tombstone.
The global offering represents 26.96 percent of the bank's ordinary share capital.
A further 33 million shares will be reserved for a possible over-allotment in case of heavy demand, known as a 'green shoe', for investors taking part in a private placement.
San Paolo, which is controlled by foundation Compagnia di San Paolo, will offer a minimum of 70 million shares to the public and of these 20 million will be reserved for employees.

The tombstone was a joint announcement by San Paolo Holding, the Italian Treasury, which holds a 3.4 percent stake in the Turin-based bank, the Italian state railway with just under three percent and Banca Nazionale delle Communicazioni with 2.4 percent.
